artist: Decorator: Attributed to William Beilby; Decorator: Attributed to Mary Beilby
creditline: Gift of funds from the Decorative Arts Council
description: goblet, about 1765-1770; glass;, bucket bowl on double series twist stem; enamel decoration showing landscape in cartouche shape; decoration attributed to shop of William (1740-1819) and Mary (1749-1797) Beilby in Newcastle-on-Tyne
text: The Beilby family is credited with introducing to England the process of enameling clear glass. Mary and her brother William were the most skilled Beilby enamelers. Their decoration varied from motifs of arms and armor to architectural ruins and rural landscapes framed in rococo flourishes, as on this goblet. The gobletâ€™s enameled decoration and air-twist stem display the light, fluid quality of the rococo style.
title: Goblet
